@Davidxvx @rg_jones The report doesn't show decadal totals in $ but this table shows scenario U1 twice the cost ofâ€¦ https://t.co/MyfifHaq3S
@Davidxvx @rg_jones Dunno, it was Carbon News that chose to report it from the conference. Anyway same old games regardless of timing.
@Davidxvx @rg_jones That's the central Infometrics case. The higher number ($72B) is from their "unilateral action" scenario (U1)
@rg_jones @Davidxvx ...leads to an absurdly high cost claim which is essentially imaginary.
@rg_jones @Davidxvx ..and NZ faces no repercussions or costs from not joining Paris Agreement. It's this ridiculous counterfactual that...
@rg_jones @Davidxvx (2) more fundamentally, the Q is "cost compared to what"? Their counterfactual is a world where no country is acting...
@rg_jones @Davidxvx But so many things wrong with this. (1) excludes forestry as abatement option, when MfE says this is lowest cost option
@rg_jones @Davidxvx That ludicrous high cost they are quoting is what model says it would cost to meet target through domestic action alone
@rg_jones @Davidxvx Govt modelling assumes very few domestic reductions cheaper than buying credits, which can certainly argue is wrong
@rg_jones Don't believe the hype. https://t.co/1VsTHD8urG
